page.title: 16Transport
page.content: A main road runs from Bolton town centre to the Royal Oak at Bradshaw.From there the roads go to Blackburn,Burnley and Bury.Traffic jams occur in the morning and at night as people living in the area tend to commute to nearby towns for work. The ring road,Crompton Way,which was built in the 1920's and takes traffic around the north side of Bolton,cuts across the main road and adds to the traffic congestion. Many of the other roads,especially in the north of the area,are little more than country roads or tracks and they have steep gradients and difficult bends.Bus services are adequate during the day but poor at night.The Manchester-Bolton railway line runs through the area with a station at Bromley Cross catering mostly for commuters.
